reviews.review:
Behzad's a great professor. He tells you exactly how to get an A in his class.

He spends as much time with us as we need to help us get a good grade.

He expects you to be able to think for yourself, but he's super chill about it, and will help you get an A.

You just have to be willing to think for yourself.
Amazing professor. One of the best classes I took at Smith.

This is one of my favorite classes I've taken at UMD. Behzad is an absolutely brilliant (and hilarious!) guy, and the content is both surprisingly interesting and extremely relevant to today's world. Have a sense of humor, do the readings, watch the films, think deeply about the material, and (most importantly!) have fun, and you will do great in the class and learn a lot. Pizza is also provided!
Behzad's a great teacher. His course is definitely worthwhile. It's worth the time and effort. If you're in UH, take his class.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Clearly put in a ton of effort to make the simulation a roller coaster that you just have to sit back and enjoy. Be opinionated and informed and you'll be totally fine on every assignment. You just have to think deeply and remember the f-word.
The financial crisis course was one of the best classes I've had at UMD. It really showed me how to think about the world in a way I'd never considered. If in UH, this is the best class they have.
